issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

fields.description: On all steps of the ELB Wizard, I noticed that the Next button is enabled regardless of the field status.  However, it's not acting as it's enabled.  I try to click on it when it appears as enabled and I am not able to proceed.  For example, on step 1, before entering any information in the 'Name' field, the button appears enabled.  If I click on it, nothing happens.  Then if I enter a valid name into the Name field and click 'Next', the wizard advances to the next step.  Also, in step 2, I can click on the Next button before entering any zone or selecting any instances and I am unable to proceed to the next step.  I have attached a screen shot that shows the behavior.
fields.summary: ELB Wizard 'Next' button always appears enabled.

comments.body: Per the work done in GUI-1984, we'll need to verify if at least one zone is required
Casey, could you verify what you saw? The linked ticket indicates how it should work in the comments.

[~dkavanagh]: Here's what's happening: The Next button is always enabled even when nothing is selected.  You can click on the next button but it doesn't proceed until you select a zone or click on an instance which automatically selects a zone for you.  The linked ticket indicates that the user is required to select a zone for the Next button to become enabled but it is already enabled even when no zones are selected.
gotcha. Seems like it's just button looking enabled when it isn't. interesting.
[~dkavanagh]: Looks like the button is even enabled from the start of the wizard when nothing is entered into the Name field.  This should be disabled from the start.
I updated the title and summary to reflect what I found.
[~dkavanagh]  I also noticed the 'Save Changes' button at the last wizard step has similar behavior.  I cleared the required fields and the 'Save Changes' button was still enabled.

The real problem is in the ELB wizard design. It uses separate controllers and assume common $scope. Every other wizard we have uses a single controller and it would be pretty simple to collapse the 2 controllers into a single one to match the rest. It would resolve this problem, but I worry about unintended issues that may push this out of scope for 4.2.2. [~jloza]?
[~dkavanagh], [~jloza]: I'm with David on refactoring the ELB wizard -- it's been a major pain point and a cause of numerous regressions.  Let's punt this to 4.3 to get the proper refactoring/fix in.
OK with me to punt to 4.3 to refactor properly and reduce risk in point release.

https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/pull/1735

GUI-2344 written for lingering issue, but general case works well now.

The availability zone is pre-populated with a zone, so the 'Next' button is activated already. I removed the AZ and the next button deactivated as expected. Approving for release. Tested with FF and IE11 on win7
